artist: Artist: Traditionally attributed to Muqi Fachang
creditline: Mary Griggs Burke Collection, Gift of the Mary and Jackson Burke Foundation
description: two branches at R with small bird perched near C
inscription:
Box inscriptions (AMR 5.10.2016):

Innermost box, inscription inside lid: 
常憲院様御遺物
宝永六年巳丑二月晦日　於
御城拜領之

Translation: Received from [Edo] Castle on the last day of the 6th month of Hoei 6 [1709], formerly in the collection of Joken\'in [Tokugawa Tsunayoshi]
	
Outermost Box, lid inscription, transcriptions with translations: 
雨中竹雀の絵　牧谿筆　一幅 (Sparrow on Bamboo in Rain by Muqi, one scroll)
東山殿御物 Former collection of Higashiyama-dono (i.e., Ashikaga shogunal collection)
柳營御物 Former collection of Ryuei (i.e., Tokugawa shogunal collection) 
玩貨名物 Ganka Meibutsu (i.e., included in the Ganka Meibutsu Ki, Record of Named Objects for Appreciation, compiled in he 1650s)
子爵　土屋正直 (Viscount Tsuchiya Masanao)
markings: Seals upper R: [Muqi]; two illegible seals LRC
provenance: Entered Tsuchiya family collection in 1709 according to a record made in 1846 of the family inventory. Former owner was Tsunenori no In (Tokugawa Tsuneyoshi). Outer box claims that this is the sparrow painting formerly in the collection of the Shogun Yoshimasa which is listed in the Ganka Meibutsu of 1660 as belonging to Abe Bitchu. This is the distinction also claimed by the "Bamboo and Sparrows" painting in the Nezu Museum known by its seal to have been in Yoshimasa's collection.
title: Sparrow on Bamboo in the Rain
